lead_paragraph: EDELSON--Phyllis Fahrie. Age 78, passed away in New York City on July 2, 2016, at home with her beloved husband of 60 years Dr. Stuart R. Edelson. The daughter of the late Bertha Cohen and Murray Fahrie, Phyllis Merle Fahrie was born on October 25, 1937 in the Bronx, New York. After receiving her Ph.D. in English from the Graduate Center of the City University of New York, Phyllis devoted her life to teaching. She was Professor and Chair of the Department of English and Communications at Pace University in Westchester County; she worked as a teacher of high school teachers, consulting widely in New York City and Westchester; and she was an expert in Australian literature, editing a book of Australian stories and serving as an editor of Antipodes magazine. After her retirement from Pace, Phyllis dedicated herself to working on her own creative writing, and then in recent years was a docent at the Morgan Library & Museum in New York City. Phyllis' life was filled with her intellectual and academic pursuits and her love of family, the opera, and the ocean. In addition to her husband, Phyllis is survived by her sons Maurice, Andrew and Glenn Fahrie Edelson, daughters-in-law Jennifer Altman and Natalia Goncharov, and grandchildren Rachel, Benjamin, Nathaniel, Ammie and Jesse. Services were on Monday, July4th. 1/3
